linkTarget.anchoringText: The fields and H2S concentrations shown in Figure 1 are based on published information. It is assumed the total number of hydrocarbon accumulations with H2S contaminations is significantly larger.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: H2S Occurrences in the Middle East & Gulf Region

formatted-caption.caption-text: H2S Occurrences in the Middle East & Gulf Region

image-wrap.caption: H2S generation processes identified in the Middle East Region

formatted-caption.caption-text: H2S generation processes identified in the Middle East Region

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: Mineralogic QEMSCAN sample showing the calcite overgrowth and the formation of pyrite as a result of thermochemical sulfate reduction of the anhydrite

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Phylogenetic tree of the bacteria assemblage of a biogenic scale sample indicating their contribution to pipeline corrosion.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Phylogenetic tree of the bacteria assemblage of a biogenic scale sample indicating their contribution to pipeline corrosion.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Figure 5 summarizes the key parameters, their impact at the different treatment locations. The listed chemicals listed are randomly selected and present a subset of the chemicals available on the market for H2S mitigation.

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: Generic parameter severity / impact scheme for various mitigation applications

formatted-caption.caption-text: Generic parameter severity / impact scheme for various mitigation applications
